http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21021v1.title: 非エルゴード的ニルシステムの構造とスペクトル
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21021v1.summary: 本論文では、エルゴード性を仮定しないニルシステムにおけるHost-Kra因子とスペクトル型を調査している。エルゴード的なニルシステムにおいて、スペクトル型が離散成分と無限多重度のルベーグ成分に分解されるという既知の性質を、非エルゴード的な場合へと拡張した。その結果として、エルゴード的な ℤ² ニルシステムのスペクトル分解が導出されている。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21021v1.appendix: 本研究は力学系の構造を扱っており、symbolic dynamicsやstructure of large countable infinite groupの分野と関連があります。エルゴード理論におけるスペクトル分解の理論を非エルゴード設定へと拡張する内容となっています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21019v1.title: Expregular関数
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21019v1.summary: 本論文では、Bojanczyk (2018)によって定義された多項式成長を持つpolyregular関数の拡張として、指数成長を持つ文字列間関数のクラスである「expregular関数」を提案している。このクラスを記述するための3つのモデル（MSO集合解釈、yield-Hennieマシン、および新しい2方向プッシュダウン機械モデルであるAriadne変換器）を提示し、それらが互いに等価であることを証明している。主要な成果として、MSO集合解釈から正則性を保存するyield-Hennieマシンへの翻訳手法を確立した。これにより、MSO集合解釈が正則性保存的であることを示し、「すべての自動的ω-語は決定可能なMSO理論を持つ」という自動構造に関する重要な予想を解決した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21019v1.appendix: 本論文は「automata theory」および「formal languages」の分野に密接に関連しています。特に、2方向プッシュダウン機械やMSO論理を用いた言語の記述、および自動構造の理論的性質を扱っています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21005v1.title: (非)線形化可能なRGD系
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21005v1.summary: RGD系が「ルート基底 B に関して線形」であるとは、ルート群間の交換関係がある種の線形性を満たすことを指し、適切なルート基底の選択により線形となる系を「線形化可能」と呼ぶ。本論文では、これまで不明であった「線形化不可能なRGD系」が非可算無限個存在することを証明し、その最初の具体的な構成例を提示した。これにより、Rémyが提唱した公理(RGD1)ₗᵢₙが公理(RGD1)の単なる強化版ではなく、実際にそれより強い制約であるという主張を裏付けている。具体的には、普遍型および2-球型の両方で線形化不可能な例が存在することを示し、特にタイプ(4, 4, 4)の2-球型RGD系において非可算な非線形化可能系が存在することを明らかにした。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21005v1.appendix: 本論文は、非可算無限個のRGD系の構造について論じており、興味ある分野である「structure of large countable infinite group」に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20890v1.title: d-次元単体的複体の最大直径
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20890v1.summary: 固定された次元dと十分に大きい頂点数nに対し、n個の頂点を持つ強連結なd-次元単体的複体における最大直径を決定した。これは一連の先行研究を改良し、2013年にSantosが提示した問題を解決するものである。その過程で、特殊なケースとして、n個の頂点を持つ完全d-一様ハイパーグラフにおけるextra-tightなオイラー回路の存在条件についても特徴付けを行っている。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20890v1.appendix: この論文は組合せ論的トポロジーや離散幾何学に関連する内容であり、提示された「興味ある分野」に直接該当するものは含まれていませんが、極値組合せ論における重要な進展を示しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20872v1.title: 複素連分数に関連する線形および非線形無限反復関数系(IFS)の極限集合
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20872v1.summary: 実連分数の反復関数系(IFS)を複素平面上の単位円板へ拡張した無限メビウスIFSであるG(d, T)と、それに対応する無限線形IFSであるF(d, T)の2つの族を導入し、その極限集合の測度論的性質を調査した。多くのパラメータ設定において、ハウスドルフ次元におけるハウスドルフ測度が0になる、あるいはパッキング次元におけるパッキング測度が無限大になるといった、無限系特有の現象が生じることを示した。また、特定の条件下ではF(d, T)の極限集合のハウスドルフ次元がG(d, T)のものよりも厳密に大きくなることを証明した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20872v1.appendix: 本論文は、複素平面上の力学系を扱う「complex dynamics」および数論的性質に関連する「arithmetic dynamics」の分野に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20864v1.title: ニュートン図形において2つの辺を持つBrunella-Miariベクトル場のモノドロミック特異点
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20864v1.summary: 本論文は、ニュートン図形が正確に2つの辺で構成される平面解析的ベクトル場ファミリーにおけるモノドロミック特異点の研究を行っています。まず、ニュートン図形の頂点に対応する単項式のみを含む多項式ベクトル場の最小モデルXの特異点解消スキームを分析します。次に、このモデルを、図形の辺上の点に関連するすべての単項式を取り込んだBrunella-Miariベクトル場X[1]へと拡張し、さらに多角形ラインより上方の高次項を含むX[2]へと拡張します。各拡張ステップにおいて特異点解消の幾何学的構造を維持することを重視し、解消された特異点が双曲的ポリサイクルに関連する場合の回帰写像Πの線形部分を計算可能にする明示的な手法を提示しています。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20864v1.appendix: 複素力学系（complex dynamics）に関連する平面解析的ベクトル場の特異点解消や、力学系の挙動を決定する回帰写像の性質を扱っています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20774v2.title: 二面体群上の準魔方陣
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20774v2.summary: 位数が n² の群 Γ のすべての元を n×n の配列に配置した Γ-準魔方陣 (Γ-semi-magic square) について、その各行および各列の元の積がある定数 μ (魔法定数) に一致する条件を研究している。本論文では、成分が二面体群 Dₖ に属する場合の n 次準魔方陣の完全な特徴付けを与えた。さらに、提案された構成法において、積を計算する順序に依存して、単一の準魔方陣が2つの異なる魔法定数を持ち得ることを示した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20774v2.appendix: 本論文は、組み合わせ論的な構造（魔方陣）と群論の性質を扱っており、興味ある分野のうち combinatorics on words と関連する代数的構造の側面を持っています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20625v1.title: 偶数の成分に制約を持つ組成の母関数
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20625v1.summary: 正の整数 n の組成（compositions）において、固定された閾値 k より大きい偶数成分の出現を制御する統計量について研究している。各組成に含まれる k より大きな偶数成分の個数を記述する2変数母関数を導入し、それが有理関数であることを示した。k のパリティに応じた母関数の明示的な閉形式を導出することで、特定の個数の大きな偶数成分を持つ組成の数に対する厳密な数え上げ公式や線形漸化式を得ている。さらに、そのような成分の総出現回数や、組成の中で最初に現れる位置などの詳細な統計量についても明示的な公式を導出している。本研究は代数曲線のゼータ関数に関連する組合せ論的展開に端を発しているが、得られた結果は純粋に組合せ論的なものである。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20625v1.appendix: 本論文は組合せ論を主軸としており、提示された[興味ある分野]の中では、数え上げ組合せ論の側面から formal languages や combinatorics on words との親和性が高い内容となっています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20623v1.title: 群上のセルオートマトンにおけるKůrkaの二分法について
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20623v1.summary: 有限生成群上のセルオートマトンにおける、初期値への鋭敏な依存性と等連続点の欠如の等価性（Kůrkaの二分法）を調査した。この二分法がvirtually-ℤ群では成立する一方、2個以上の生成元を持つ自由群では成立しないことを示した。また、ある群でこの二分法が成立する場合、そのすべての部分群でも成立することを証明した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20623v1.appendix: この論文は、symbolic dynamicsおよびstrucure of large countable infinite groupの分野に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20606v1.title: 一様重み付き平均とBergelson, Moreira, Richterによる予想
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20606v1.summary: Bergelson, Moreira, Richterによる予想(arXiv:1711.05729)を肯定的に解決した。具体的には、確率測度保存系(X, B, μ, T)において、測度が正の集合Aおよび緩増加関数(tempered function)fに対し、多重再帰の極限値が正になることを示した。これは、Banach空間上の有界数列について、重み関数Wを用いた重み付き平均が収束するならば、通常のCesàro平均も同じ値に収束するという条件を確立することで達成された。さらに、この手法を応用し、正の上密度を持つ集合Eが、特定の非多項式的な等差数列的構造を含むという組合せ論的結果を強化した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20606v1.appendix: この論文は、正の上密度を持つ集合の構造や力学系の再帰性を扱っており、combinatorics on wordsやsymbolic dynamicsに関連する組合せ論的・力学的側面を有しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20588v1.title: Julia集合と不変レイの連続性
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20588v1.summary: 放物的周期点を持つ有理写像 f の典型的な摂動 (fₙ)ₙ について、Julia集合と不変レイのHausdorff収束および周期点の倍数のホロサイクル収束の関係を調査している。放物的爆発理論（parabolic implosion theory）を用いて等価な特徴付けを確立した。これは摂動により誘起されるゲート構造に対する木のエッジ力学の解析に基づいており、Oudkerkのアルゴリズムにより近放物的摂動の軌道を追跡している。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20588v1.appendix: 興味ある分野のうち、complex dynamics（複素力学系）に関連する研究内容です。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20536v1.title: ピタゴラスの三つ組の量子化
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20536v1.summary: ピタゴラスの方程式 a² + b² = c² の、標準的なものとは異なる多項式版としての q-変形を導入している。すべての原始ピタゴラスの三つ組、および「標準的」と呼ばれるより広いクラスの三つ組に対して、多項式による q-類似を構成した。この手法は q-変形された有理数とモジュラー群 PSL(2, ℤ) の概念に基づいている。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20536v1.appendix: 本研究は q-変形された有理数やモジュラー群を扱っており、興味ある分野の中では arithmetic dynamics に関連する可能性があります。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20462v1.title: ハミング立方体における急峻な等周不等式 II：臨界指数
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20462v1.summary: 臨界指数 β = 1/2 におけるハミング立方体の急峻な等周不等式を証明した。本研究は、β が 1/2 に近い場合について境界を確立した先行研究をさらに発展させたものである。この成果により、立方体分割に関する Kahn と Park の予想が解決されたほか、Boolean 値関数に対する急峻な L¹ ポアンカレ不等式が導出された。また、情報理論におけるノイズのある Boolean チャネルに関する Hellinger 予想で予測されていた、バランス関数に対する低ノイズ極限が裏付けられた。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.20462v1.appendix: ハミング立方体や立方体分割の性質を扱っており、興味ある分野のうち combinatorics に強く関連する内容です。

papers.title: On the Computation Rate of All-Reduce
papers.summary: In the All-Reduce problem, each one of the K nodes holds an input and wishes to compute the sum of all K inputs through a communication network where each pair of nodes is connected by a parallel link with arbitrary bandwidth. The computation rate of All-Reduce is defined as the number of sum instances that can be computed over each network use. For the computation rate, we provide a cut-set upper bound and a linear programming lower bound based on time (bandwidth) sharing over all schemes that first perform Reduce (aggregating all inputs at one node) and then perform Broadcast (sending the sum from that node to all other nodes). Specializing the two general bounds gives us the optimal computation rate for a class of communication networks and the best-known rate bounds (where the upper bound is no more than twice of the lower bound) for cyclic, complete, and hypercube networks.

papers.title: Layered Monoidal Theories II: Fibrational Semantics
papers.summary: Layered monoidal theories provide a categorical framework for studying scientific theories at different levels of abstraction, via string diagrammatic algebra. We introduce models for three closely related classes of layered monoidal theories: fibrational, opfibrational and deflational theories. We prove soundness and completeness of these theories for the respective models. Our work reveals connections between layered monoidal theories and well-known categorical structures such as Grothendieck fibrations and displayed categories.

papers.title: Quadratization of Autonomous Partial Differential Equations: Theory and Algorithms
papers.summary: Quadratization for partial differential equations (PDEs) is a process that transforms a nonquadratic PDE into a quadratic form by introducing auxiliary variables. This symbolic transformation has been used in diverse fields to simplify the analysis, simulation, and control of nonlinear and nonquadratic PDE models. This paper presents a rigorous definition of PDE quadratization, theoretical results for the PDE quadratization problem of spatially one-dimensional PDEs-including results on existence and complexity-and introduces QuPDE, an algorithm based on symbolic computation and discrete optimization that outputs a quadratization for any spatially one-dimensional polynomial or rational PDE. This algorithm is the first computational tool to find quadratizations for PDEs to date. We demonstrate QuPDE's performance by applying it to fourteen nonquadratic PDEs in diverse areas such as fluid mechanics, space physics, chemical engineering, and biological processes. QuPDE delivers a low-order quadratization in each case, uncovering quadratic transformations with fewer auxiliary variables than those previously discovered in the literature for some examples, and finding quadratizations for systems that had not been transformed to quadratic form before.

papers.title: Ramanujan subshifts
papers.summary: A finite, connected, $(d+1)$-regular graph $G$ is called Ramanujan if every its eigenvalue $λ$ satisfies either $λ=\pm (d+1)$ or $|λ|\leq 2\sqrt{d}$. The Ramanujan condition corresponds to the optimal rate of decay of correlations for the associated non-backtracking edge subshift. We consider a higher-dimensional generalization of this observation. We introduce the notion of a $d$-regular $\mathbb{Z}^δ$-subshift of finite type, and we define a Ramanujan subshift as a $d$-regular $\mathbb{Z}^δ$-subshift with an optimal rate of decay of correlations. We show that for every odd prime power $q\geq 3$ and dimension $δ<q$, there exists a $q$-regular Ramanujan $\mathbb{Z}^δ$-subshift. The construction is based on the quaternionic lattices over $\mathbb{F}_q(t)$ introduced by Rungtanapirom-Stix-Vdovina (2019). Each of our $q$-regular Ramanujan subshifts gives rise to a family of non-bipartite $(q+1)$-regular Ramanujan graphs. These graphs are very explicit and local in the strong sense: the neighbors of any vertex can be computed by an explicit Mealy automaton associated with the subshift. As a byproduct, for every odd prime power $q$, we get a single lifting rule that can be iterated to produce an infinite family of $(q+1)$-regular Ramanujan graphs.

papers.title: Pólya enumeration, wreath product symmetric functions, and moduli spaces of curves
papers.summary: We develop a calculus for $S_n$-equivariant Euler characteristics of moduli spaces of stable curves and stable maps. Our approach involves an enrichment of Pólya's cycle index polynomial of a graph to a certain algebra $Λ^{[2]}$ of wreath product symmetric functions. Building on foundational work of Macdonald, we prove that $Λ^{[2]}$ may be viewed as the Grothendieck ring of the category of polynomial functors which map symmetric sequences of vector spaces to vector spaces. This interpretation gives rise to an action of $Λ^{[2]}$ on the ordinary ring of symmetric functions $Λ$, which is described concretely in terms of Adams operations and skewing by power sums. This action lets us deduce appealing formulas, involving only ordinary symmetric functions, for generating functions of $S_n$-equivariant Euler characteristics.

papers.title: The Lens of Abelian Embeddings
papers.summary: We discuss a recent line of research investigating inverse theorems with respect to general k-wise correlations, and explain how such correlations arise in different contexts in mathematics. We outline some of the results that were established and their applications in discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science. We also mention some open problems for future research.

papers.title: Around homogeneity
papers.summary:
Forty-five years ago, a young researcher in finite permutation group theory encountered a paper by Robert Woodrow. The homogeneous triangle-free graph Woodrow described there seemed to be an infinite analogue of the Higman--Sims graph which had played an important role in the researcher's thesis. The encounter changed the course of the researcher's career. This paper is the story of that event and its aftermath.
  The final section of the paper suggests that Fraïssé classes of rigid structures are a potentially interesting generalisation of Ramsey classes.

papers.title: Enhancing Framingham Cardiovascular Risk Score Transparency through Logic-Based XAI
papers.summary: Cardiovascular disease (CVD) remains one of the leading global health challenges, accounting for more than 19 million deaths worldwide. To address this, several tools that aim to predict CVD risk and support clinical decision making have been developed. In particular, the Framingham Risk Score (FRS) is one of the most widely used and recommended worldwide. However, it does not explain why a patient was assigned to a particular risk category nor how it can be reduced. Due to this lack of transparency, we present a logical explainer for the FRS. Based on first-order logic and explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) fundaments, the explainer is capable of identifying a minimal set of patient attributes that are sufficient to explain a given risk classification. Our explainer also produces actionable scenarios that illustrate which modifiable variables would reduce a patient's risk category. We evaluated all possible input combinations of the FRS (over 22,000 samples) and tested them with our explainer, successfully identifying important risk factors and suggesting focused interventions for each case. The results may improve clinician trust and facilitate a wider implementation of CVD risk assessment by converting opaque scores into transparent and prescriptive insights, particularly in areas with restricted access to specialists.

papers.title: Sheaves as oracle computations
papers.summary: In type theory, an oracle may be specified abstractly by a predicate whose domain is the type of queries asked of the oracle, and whose proofs are the oracle answers. Such a specification induces an oracle modality that captures a computational intuition about oracles: at each step of reasoning we either know the result, or we ask the oracle a query and proceed upon receiving an answer. We characterize an oracle modality as the least one forcing the given predicate. We establish an adjoint retraction between modalities and propositional containers, from which it follows that every modality is an oracle modality. The left adjoint maps sums to suprema, which makes suprema of modalities easy to compute when they are given in terms of oracle modalities. We also study sheaves for oracle modalities. We describe sheafification in terms of a quotient-inductive type of computation trees, and describe sheaves as algebras for the corresponding monad. We also introduce equifoliate trees, an intensional notion of oracle computation given by a (non-propositional) container. Equifoliate trees descend to sheaves, and lift from sheaves in case the container is projective. As an application, we give a concrete description of all Lawvere-Tierney topologies in a realizability topos, closely related to a game-theoretic characterization by Takayuki Kihara.

papers.title: Enumeration of Nondegenerate $2 \times (k+1) \times k$ Hypermatrices
papers.summary: We consider the problem of enumerating hypermatrices of format $2 \times (k + 1) \times k$ over a finite field that have nonzero hyperdeterminant and whose nonzero entries are restricted to a plane partition. We conjecture an attractive product formula for the enumeration, and prove it in many cases. In general, we show that the enumeration is given (up to a power of $q - 1$) by a polynomial in $q$ with nonnegative integer coefficients, whose value at $q = 1$ enumerates a natural family of three-dimensional rook placements.

papers.title: Quadratic Equations over Graph Products and the Exponent of Periodicity
papers.summary:
In 1977, Makanin established the decidability of equations in free monoids. A key ingredient in his proof is the exponent of periodicity: for a word $w$, it is the largest exponent $e$ such that $w$ contains a nonempty factor of the form $p^e$. Makanin showed that if a system of equations in a free monoid has a solution with sufficiently large exponent of periodicity, then it has infinitely many solutions. However, the converse -- whether the existence of infinitely many solutions implies the existence of solutions with arbitrarily large exponent of periodicity -- remains open.
  In this paper, we investigate the analogous problem for quadratic equations in finitely generated groups. Using normal forms to define the exponent of periodicity, we identify structural conditions on groups and their normal forms that guarantee that infinite solution sets of quadratic systems have an unbounded exponent of periodicity. We prove that these conditions are preserved under graph products and, in particular, hold for all finitely generated right-angled Artin groups. In addition, we show that they also hold for finitely generated (graph products of) torsion-free nilpotent and hyperbolic groups, and we characterize the Baumslag-Solitar groups satisfying them.

papers.title: Slice and Explain: Logic-Based Explanations for Neural Networks through Domain Slicing
papers.summary: Neural networks (NNs) are pervasive across various domains but often lack interpretability. To address the growing need for explanations, logic-based approaches have been proposed to explain predictions made by NNs, offering correctness guarantees. However, scalability remains a concern in these methods. This paper proposes an approach leveraging domain slicing to facilitate explanation generation for NNs. By reducing the complexity of logical constraints through slicing, we decrease explanation time by up to 40\% less time, as indicated through comparative experiments. Our findings highlight the efficacy of domain slicing in enhancing explanation efficiency for NNs.

papers.title: Robust Permutation Flowshops Under Budgeted Uncertainty
papers.summary: We consider the robust permutation flowshop problem under the budgeted uncertainty model, where at most a given number of job processing times may deviate on each machine. We show that solutions for this problem can be determined by solving polynomially many instances of the corresponding nominal problem. As a direct consequence, our result implies that this robust flowshop problem can be solved in polynomial time for two machines, and can be approximated in polynomial time for any fixed number of machines. The reduction that is our main result follows from an analysis similar to Bertsimas and Sim (2003) except that dualization is applied to the terms of a min-max objective rather than to a linear objective function. Our result may be surprising considering that heuristic and exact integer programming based methods have been developed in the literature for solving the two-machine flowshop problem. We conclude by showing a logarithmic factor improvement in the overall running time implied by a naive reduction to nominal problems in the case of two machines and three machines.

papers.title: Linear clique-width and modular decomposition
papers.summary: A hereditary class of graphs has bounded clique-width if and only if its prime members do, but this lifting property fails for linear clique-width. We prove that a hereditary class has bounded linear clique-width if and only if its prime members do and it contains neither all quasi-threshold graphs nor all complements of quasi-threshold graphs. This generalizes a result of Brignall, Korpelainen, and Vatter, who established the result for cographs.

papers.title: On a Cauchy theorem for finite skew braces
papers.summary: One of the major problems in the structural theory of skew braces consists in the classification of skew braces of finite order up to isomorphism. In this light, the open question of the existence of a Cauchy theorem for finite skew braces is of great interest. We prove a positive answer for the classes of finite two-sided skew braces and bi-skew braces. Consequences and related structural results are also outlined.

papers.title: RustyDL: A Program Logic for Rust
papers.summary: Rust is a modern programming language that guarantees memory safety and the absence of data races with a strong type system. We present RustyDL, a program logic for Rust, as a foundation for an auto-interactive, deductive verification tool for Rust. RustyDL reasons about Rust programs directly on the source code level, in contrast to other tools that are all based on translation to an intermediate language. A source-level program logic for Rust is crucial for a human-in-the-loop (HIL) style of verification that permits proving highly complex functional properties. We discuss specific Rust challenges in designing a program logic and calculus for HIL-style verification and propose a solution in each case. We provide a proof-of-concept of our ideas in the form of a prototype of a Rust instance of the deductive verification tool KeY.

papers.title: Maximal Recoverability: A Nexus of Coding Theory
papers.summary:
In the modern era of large-scale computing systems, a crucial use of error correcting codes is to judiciously introduce redundancy to ensure recoverability from failure. To get the most out of every byte, practitioners and theorists have introduced the framework of maximal recoverability (MR) to study optimal error-correcting codes in various architectures. In this survey, we dive into the study of two families of MR codes: MR locally recoverable codes (LRCs) (also known as partial MDS codes) and grid codes (GCs).
  For each of these two families of codes, we discuss the primary recoverability guarantees as well as what is known concerning optimal constructions. Along the way, we discuss many surprising connections between MR codes and broader questions in computer science and mathematics. For MR LRCs, the use of skew polynomial codes has unified many previous constructions. For MR GCs, the theory of higher order MDS codes shows that MR GCs can be used to construct optimal list-decodable codes. Furthermore, the optimally recoverable patterns of MR GCs have close ties to long-standing problems on the structural rigidity of graphs.

papers.title: Target controllability for a minimum time problem in a trait-structured chemostat model
papers.summary: In this paper, we consider a minimum time control problem governed by a trait-structured chemostat model including mutation and one limiting substrate. Our first main result proves the well-posedness of the control-to-state mapping. We subsequently analyze the class of auxostat-type controls, feedback laws designed to regulate substrate concentration, and prove that the corresponding solutions converge to a stationary state of the system. These convergence results are used to show the reachability of a target set corresponding to the selection of a population with a low weighted averaged half-saturation constant. Finally, we show the existence of an optimal control for the minimum time problem associated with reaching the target set. These theoretical findings are completed by numerical simulations.

papers.title: On combinatorial bounds for the total Tjurina numbers of certain curves and surfaces with isolated singularities
papers.summary: We investigate combinatorial bounds for the total Tjurina numbers of plane curve arrangements. Focusing on arrangements of lines and conics in $\mathbb{P}^2$ that admit only ordinary quasi-homogeneous singularities, we derive new structural inequalities governing the distribution of multiple intersection points. As a consequence, we establish sharp lower bounds for the total Tjurina numbers of free line arrangements with bounded maximal multiplicity and, more generally, for free conic-line arrangements. In particular, we show that for a free arrangement of $d$ lines and $k$ conics, the total Tjurina number grows at least quadratically in $d$ and $k$, and we demonstrate that this bound is sharp. As an application of these planar results, we construct a family of surfaces in $\mathbb{P}^{3}$ with only isolated singularities and arbitrarily large total Tjurina numbers.This provides new lower bounds for the total Tjurina numbers of certain hypersurfaces that are independent of detailed homological data.

papers.title: Reliable XAI Explanations in Sudden Cardiac Death Prediction for Chagas Cardiomyopathy
papers.summary: Sudden cardiac death (SCD) is unpredictable, and its prediction in Chagas cardiomyopathy (CC) remains a significant challenge, especially in patients not classified as high risk. While AI and machine learning models improve risk stratification, their adoption is hindered by a lack of transparency, as they are often perceived as \textit{black boxes} with unclear decision-making processes. Some approaches apply heuristic explanations without correctness guarantees, leading to mistakes in the decision-making process. To address this, we apply a logic-based explainability method with correctness guarantees to the problem of SCD prediction in CC. This explainability method, applied to an AI classifier with over 95\% accuracy and recall, demonstrated strong predictive performance and 100\% explanation fidelity. When compared to state-of-the-art heuristic methods, it showed superior consistency and robustness. This approach enhances clinical trust, facilitates the integration of AI-driven tools into practice, and promotes large-scale deployment, particularly in endemic regions where it is most needed.

papers.title: On the expansion formulas of cluster varieties from surfaces and their combinatorial properties
papers.summary: This paper explores the cluster algebra structure of the moduli space $\mathscr{A}_{\mathrm{SL}_{n+1},\mathbb{S}}$ of twisted $\mathrm{SL}_{n+1}$-local systems on a surface. We derive general recurrence relations for cluster variables arising from flips of a triangulation, corresponding to specific sequences of mutations. Our approach is grounded in a detailed combinatorial analysis over the standard $n$-triangulated $m$-gon (with explicit calculations for $n=1,2$). As a generalization, the non-simply-laced $G_2$ type is also considered. We prove the "well-triangulated" property for cluster mutations under flips, which provides a combinatorial framework for understanding the stability and transformation rules of these cluster algebra structures, and compute the monomial counts for the cluster expansion formula.

papers.title: Symbols frequencies in the Thue--Morse word in base $3/2$ and related conjectures
papers.summary: We study a binary Thue--Morse-type sequence arising from the base-$3/2$ expansion of integers, an archetypal automatic sequence in a rational base numeration system. Because the sequence is generated by a periodic iteration of morphisms rather than a single primitive substitution, classical Perron--Frobenius methods do not directly apply to determine symbol frequencies. We prove that both symbols ${\tt 0},{\tt 1}$ occur with frequency $1/2$ and we show uniform recurrence and symmetry properties of its set of factors. The proof reveals a structural bridge between combinatorics on words and harmonic analysis: the first difference sequence is shown to be Toeplitz, providing dynamical rigidity, while filtered frequencies naturally encode a dyadic structure that lifts to the compact group of $2$-adic integers. In this $2$-adic setting, desubstitution becomes a linear operator on Fourier coefficients, and a spectral contraction argument enforces uniqueness of limiting densities. Our results answer several conjectures of Dekking (on a sibling sequence) and illustrate how harmonic analysis on compact groups can be fruitfully combined with substitution dynamics.

papers.title: Strata of Weyl groups
papers.summary: A Weyl group W is a union of strata (certain subsets which are unions of conjugacy classes) which are the nonempty fibres of a map from W to the set of irreducible representations of W. We give an explicit description of strata in terms of a certain modified centralizer group. We also define superstrata of a connected reductive group and state a conjecture about them.

papers.title: The perturbation threshold of degenerate graphs
papers.summary:
We show that for any $d\ge 2$ and $Δ>0$ there exists $η>0$ such that the following holds: Let $G$ be an $n$-vertex graph with at least $Ω(n^2)$ edges and let $H$ be an $n$-vertex $d$-degenerate graph with maximum degree at most $Δ$. Then with high probability, $G \cup G(n, n^{-1/d - η})$ contains a copy of $H$. We also prove that the same conclusion extends to $d$-regular graphs with $d\ge 4$ satisfying a certain edge expansion property, with the threshold improved to $n^{-2/d - η}$. Such a property is satisfied by almost all
  $d$-regular graphs and for even $d$, by the $(d/2)$-th power of a Hamilton cycle.

papers.title: Steiner Forest for $H$-Subgraph-Free Graphs
papers.summary:
Our main result is a full classification, for every connected graph $H$, of the computational complexity of Steiner Forest on $H$-subgraph-free graphs. To obtain this dichotomy, we establish the following new algorithmic, hardness, and combinatorial results:
  Algorithms: We identify two new classes of graph-theoretical structures that make it possible to solve Steiner Forest in polynomial time. Roughly speaking, our algorithms handle the following cases: (1) a set $X$ of vertices of bounded size that are pairwise connected by subgraphs of treewidth $2$ or bounded size, possibly together with an independent set of arbitrary size that is connected to $X$ in an arbitrary way; (2) a set $X$ of vertices of arbitrary size that are pairwise connected in a cyclic manner by subgraphs of treewidth $2$ or bounded size.
  Hardness results: We show that Steiner Forest remains NP-complete for graphs with 2-deletion set number $3$. (The $c$-deletion set number is the size of a smallest cutset $S$ such that every component of $G-S$ has at most $c$ vertices.)
  Combinatorial results: To establish the dichotomy, we perform a delicate graph-theoretic analysis showing that if $H$ is a path or a subdivided claw, then excluding $H$ as a subgraph either yields one of the two algorithmically favourable structures described above, or yields a graph class for which NP-completeness of Steiner Forest follows from either our new hardness result or a previously known one.
  Along the way to classifying the hardness for excluded subgraphs, we establish a dichotomy for graphs with $c$-deletion set number at most $k$. Specifically, our results together with pre-existing ones show that Steiner Forest is polynomial-time solvable if (1) $c=1$ and $k\geq 0$, or (2) $c=2$ and $k\leq 2$, or (3) $c\geq 3$ and $k=1$, and is NP-complete otherwise.

papers.title: On subgroup growth of iterated wreath products in product action
papers.summary: We show that there are hereditarily just infinite groups of any subgroup growth type between $n$ and $n^{\log n}$. This is obtained calculating the subgroup growth type of a family of hereditarily just infinite profinite groups obtained via iterated wreath products of finite permutation groups with respect to product actions.

papers.title: A kernel for the maximum agreement forest problem on multiple binary phylogenetic trees
papers.summary: The maximum agreement forest (MAF) problem in phylogenetics takes as input a set t >=2 of binary phylogenetic trees T on the same set of taxa X. It asks for a partition X into the smallest number of blocks such that the subtrees induced by these blocks are disjoint and have common topology across all the trees in T. We produce a modified version of the well-known chain reduction rule in order to prove the existence of a kernel of size O( t * r * k ) where k is the natural parameter (the number of blocks) and r=min{max{k,3},t+1}}. We prove this bound for both the unrooted and rooted version of the problem, and demonstrate that the bound r, the length to which common chains are truncated, is tight. Our results constitute the first kernels for MAF in the t > 2 regime.

papers.title: The average order of a connected vertex set in $K_m \times P_n$
papers.summary: Let $G$ be a connected graph. Let $N(G)$ and $S(G)$ be the number of connected sets of $G$ and the sum of the orders of these connected sets of $G$, respectively. Then $A(G)=\frac{S(G)}{N(G)}$ is called the average order of a connected set of $G$. In this paper, we derive a closed-form formula for $A(K_m \times P_n)$, where $K_m \times P_n$ is the Cartesian product of the complete graph $K_m$ and the path $P_n$.

papers.title: Kernel Methods for the Construction of Certified Lyapunov Functions via Approximate Koopman Eigenfunctions
papers.summary: We present a kernel-based methodology for constructing Lyapunov functions for nonlinear dynamical systems using approximate Koopman eigenfunctions. Our approach decomposes principal Koopman eigenfunctions into linear and nonlinear components, where the linear part is obtained from the system's linearization and the nonlinear part is computed by solving a partial differential equation using symmetric kernel collocation in reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces (RKHS). The resulting Lyapunov function is constructed as a quadratic form in the approximate eigenfunctions. We establish error bounds relating the approximation quality to the fill distance of collocation points and provide a certification procedure using continuous piecewise affine (CPA) methods. Numerical experiments on benchmark systems, including a polynomial system and the Duffing oscillator, demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach.

papers.title: Chirality and Racemization on Isotopy Classes of Loops: A Groupoid-Based Structural Theory
papers.summary: We develop a theory of chirality and racemization on isotopy classes of finite loops, formulated intrinsically within the loop isotopy groupoid understood in the categorical sense. Motivated by earlier work on quasigroups \cite{InoueQuasiChirality} and by the classical medical paradigm of mirror-related enantiomers, we restrict admissible mirror transitions to those generated by intrinsic, unit-preserving symmetries. Within this framework, racemization is modeled as a two-state dynamics on isotopy classes, with an effective rate determined by the presence of mirror-isotopisms. Our main result shows that this rate vanishes if and only if no loop isotopism exists between a loop and its opposite, providing a structural criterion for chirality. A strengthened variant based on translation-generated symmetries is discussed in the appendix.

papers.title: Perpetually Fair Assignments Via Balanced Sequences of Permutations
papers.summary:
There is a set of n indivisible items (or chores), and a set of n players. Each day, a single item should be assigned to each player. We want to ensure that all players feel that they have been treated fairly, not only after the last day, but after every single day. We present two 'balance' conditions on sequences of permutations. One condition can always be satisfied, but is arguably too weak; a second condition is strong, and can be satisfied for all n <= 11, but cannot be satisfied for some larger values of n, including all n>61.
  We then relate the 'balance' condition to the requirement that the cumulative assignment is proportional up to one item (PROP1), where proportionality holds in a strong ordinal sense -- for every valuations that are consistent with the item ranking. We present a third balance condition that implies ordinal PROP1. We show that a sequence guaranteeing this balance condition exists for all n <= 12, but might not exist when n=6k for any k >= 19.
  Finally, we present a fourth, weaker balance condition on a sequence, that guarantees ordinal proportionality up to two items (PROP2). Whether or not this condition can be satisfied for all n remains an open question.

papers.title: Error-awareness Accelerates Active Automata Learning
papers.summary: Active automata learning (AAL) algorithms can learn a behavioral model of a system from interacting with it. The primary challenge remains scaling to larger models, in particular in the presence of many possible inputs to the system. Modern AAL algorithms fail to scale even if, in every state, most inputs lead to errors. In various challenging problems from the literature, these errors are observable, i.e., they emit a known error output. Motivated by these problems, we study learning these systems more efficiently. Further, we consider various degrees of knowledge about which inputs are non-error producing at which state. For each level of knowledge, we provide a matching adaptation of the state-of-the-art AAL algorithm L# to make the most of this domain knowledge. Our empirical evaluation demonstrates that the methods accelerate learning by orders of magnitude with strong but realistic domain knowledge to a single order of magnitude with limited domain knowledge.

papers.title: On the Number of Connected Edge Cover Sets of Some Graph Families
papers.summary: Let $G=(V,E)$ be a simple connected graph. A connected edge cover of $G$ is a subset $S\subseteq E$ such that every vertex of $G$ is incident with at least one edge in $S$ and the subgraph induced by $S$ is connected. The connected edge cover polynomial of $G$ is defined as $E_c(G,x)=\sum_{i} e_c(G,i)x^i$, where $e_c(G,i)$ denotes the number of connected edge covers of $G$ with exactly $i$ edges. In this paper, we derive explicit formulas for both the connected edge cover polynomials and the total number of connected edge covers for several important graph families, including wheels, complete graphs $K_n$, complete bipartite graphs $K_{2,n}$, friendship graphs, and lollipop graphs. Each formula is accompanied by a combinatorial proof and verified by computational enumeration for small orders.

papers.title: On the Maximum Number of Spanning Trees in $C_4$-Free Graphs
papers.summary: We introduce a ``Kirchhoff--Turán'' variant of the extremal $C_4$ problem: among all simple connected $n$-vertex $C_4$-free graphs $G$, maximize the number of spanning trees $τ(G)$. For the projective-plane orders $n=q^2+q+1$ we compute an exact formula for the Erdős--Rényi orthogonal polarity graph $ER_q$, namely $τ(ER_q)=n^{(n-3)/2}$, via a polarity spectral identity and Kirchhoff's matrix--tree theorem. We also give an explicit general upper bound on $\mathrm{st}(n,C_4)$ at these $n$ using a sharp degree-sequence inequality for $τ(G)$ and a degree-balancing argument; this matches the lower bound in the leading exponential term.

papers.title: Towers and Bratteli-Vershik systems in Fibonacci-like unimodal maps
papers.summary: For a class of Fibonacci-like unimodal maps, the restriction to the $ω$-limit set of the unique turning point defines a minimal Cantor system. We construct these Cantor sets geometrically using a nested sequence of finite covers with a tower structure. From this tower structure, we recover the associated Bratteli-Vershik model determined by the cutting times and obtain an explicit formula for the unique ergodic invariant probability measure supported on the $ω$-limit set. We conclude with applications illustrating the scope of the construction.

papers.title: Equivariant log concavity and the $\operatorname{FI^\sharp}$-module structure on $H^i(\operatorname{Conf}(n,\mathbb{R}^d))$
papers.summary: Previous work has conjectured that the graded $\mathfrak{S}_n$-representations $H^\bullet(\operatorname{Conf}(n,\mathbb{R}^d);\mathbb{Q})$ are strongly equivariantly log concave, and has proven this conjecture in low degrees. By leveraging the theory of representation stability, we are able instead prove a stronger statement about the $\operatorname{FI^\sharp}$-module structure on $H^i(\operatorname{Conf}(n,\mathbb{R}^d);\mathbb{Q})$ which implies the original conjecture up to degree 19. We conjecture that this equivariant log concavity-like property holds in all degrees for the $\operatorname{FI^\sharp}$-modules $H^i(\operatorname{Conf}(n,\mathbb{R}^d);\mathbb{Q})$.

papers.title: Spectral radius, toughness, binding number and $k$-factor of graphs
papers.summary: A $k$-regular spanning subgraph of $G$ is called a $k$-factor. In this paper, we provide spectral radius and edge conditions to ensure that a graph $G$ with $δ(G)\ge k$ admits a $k$-factor. Fan, Lin and Lu [European J. Combin. 110 (2023) 103701] presented a tight sufficient condition in terms of the spectral radius for a connected 1-tough graph to contain a connected 2-factor (Hamilton cycle). Then it is interesting to consider the following problem: What is the spectral radius condition to guarantee the existence of a $k$-factor with $k\ge3$ in a connected 1-tough graph $G$ with $δ(G)\ge k$? We completely solve this problem, and we further obtain a sufficient spectral radius condition for the existence of a $k$-factor in a connected 1-binding graph, which solves an important problem posed by Fan and Lin [Electron. J. Combin. 31 (2024) 1--30].

papers.title: DRESS and the WL Hierarchy: Climbing One Deletion at a Time
papers.summary: The Cai--Fürer--Immerman (CFI) construction provides the canonical family of hard instances for the Weisfeiler--Leman (WL) hierarchy: distinguishing the two non-isomorphic CFI graphs over a base graph $G$ requires $k$-WL where $k$ meets or exceeds the treewidth of $G$. In this paper, we introduce $Δ^\ell$-DRESS, which applies $\ell$ levels of iterated node deletion to the DRESS continuous structural refinement framework. $Δ^\ell$-DRESS runs Original-DRESS on all $\binom{n}{\ell}$ subgraphs obtained by removing $\ell$ nodes, and compares the resulting histograms. We show empirically on the canonical CFI benchmark family that Original-DRESS ($Δ^0$) already distinguishes $\text{CFI}(K_3)$ (requiring 2-WL), and that each additional deletion level extends the range by one WL level: $Δ^1$ reaches 3-WL, $Δ^2$ reaches 4-WL, and $Δ^3$ reaches 5-WL, distinguishing CFI pairs over $K_n$ for $n = 3, \ldots, 6$. Crucially, $Δ^3$ fails on $\text{CFI}(K_7)$ (requiring 6-WL), confirming a sharp boundary at $(\ell+2)$-WL. The computational cost is $\mathcal{O}\bigl(\binom{n}{\ell} \cdot I \cdot m \cdot d_{\max}\bigr)$ -- polynomial in $n$ for fixed $\ell$. These results establish $Δ^\ell$-DRESS as a practical framework for systematically climbing the WL hierarchy on the canonical CFI benchmark family.

papers.title: Signs of Hamiltonian Circles in Simple Plane Signed Graphs
papers.summary: We study which signs can occur among Hamiltonian circles in simple plane signed graphs. Using a face-based viewpoint, we relate the sign of a Hamiltonian circle to the product of the signs of the faces inside it, and we introduce co-Hamiltonian sequences. This yields a criterion for the existence of opposite-sign Hamiltonian circles via two co-Hamiltonian sequences with opposite face-products. Motivated by signed grid graphs, we develop local structural theorems that allow one to certify the existence of both signs without explicitly constructing the full sequences, including a ladder-type configuration where toggling along two $4$-circles produces Hamiltonian circles of opposite sign, as well as hexagon configurations that realize both signs.

papers.title: 2-dimensional unit vector flows
papers.summary: We study $2$-dimensional unit vector flows on graphs, that is, nowhere-zero flows that assign to each oriented edge a unit vector in $\mathbb R^{3}$. We give a new geometric characterization of $\mathbb S^{2}$-flows on cubic graphs. We also prove that the class of cubic graphs admitting an $\mathbb S^{2}$-flow is closed under a natural composition operation, which yields further constructions; in particular, blowing up a vertex into a triangle preserves the existence of an $\mathbb S^{2}$-flow. Our second contribution is algebraic: we extend the rank-based approach of [SIAM J. Discrete Math., 29 (2015), pp.~2166--2178] from $\mathbb S^{1}$-flows to $\mathbb S^{2}$-flows. More precisely, we show that if an $\mathbb S^{2}$-flow $\varphi$ satisfies $\operatorname{rank}(S_{\mathbb{Q}}(\varphi))\le 2$ and $S_{\mathbb{Q}}(\varphi)$ is odd-coordinate-free, then the graph admits a nowhere-zero $4$-flow.

papers.title: The constructions of Singleton-optimal locally repairable codes with minimum distance 6 and locality 3
papers.summary: In this paper, we present new constructions of $q$-ary Singleton-optimal locally repairable codes (LRCs) with minimum distance $d=6$ and locality $r=3$, based on combinatorial structures from finite geometry. By exploiting the well-known correspondence between a complete set of mutually orthogonal Latin squares (MOLS) of order $q$ and the affine plane $\mathrm{AG}(2,q)$, We systematically construct families of disjoint 4-arcs in the projective plane $\mathrm{PG}(2,q)$, such that the union of any two distinct 4-arcs forms an 8-arc. These 4-arcs form what we call 4-local arcs, and their existence is equivalent to that of the desired codes. For any prime power $q\ge 7$, our construction yields codes of length $n = 2q$, $2q-2$, or $2q-6$ depending on whether $q$ is even, $q\equiv 3 \pmod{4}$, or $q\equiv 1 \pmod{4}$, respectively.

papers.title: Regular Expression Denial of Service Induced by Backreferences
papers.summary: This paper presents the first systematic study of denial-of-service vulnerabilities in Regular Expressions with Backreferences (REwB). We introduce the Two-Phase Memory Automaton (2PMFA), an automaton model that precisely captures REwB semantics. Using this model, we derive necessary conditions under which backreferences induce super-linear backtracking runtime, even when sink ambiguity is linear -- a regime where existing detectors report no vulnerability. Based on these conditions, we identify three vulnerability patterns, develop detection and attack-construction algorithms, and validate them in practice. Using the Snort intrusion detection ruleset, our evaluation identifies 45 previously unknown REwB vulnerabilities with quadratic or worse runtime. We further demonstrate practical exploits against Snort, including slowing rule evaluation by 0.6-1.2 seconds and bypassing alerts by triggering PCRE's matching limit.

papers.title: The Multicolor Size-Ramsey Number of Bipartite Long Subdivisions
papers.summary:
For a positive integer $r$, the $r$-color size-Ramsey
  number~$\widehat{R}_r(H)$ of a graph $H$ is the minimum number of
  edges in a graph $G$ such that every $r$-edge coloring of $G$
  contains a monochromatic copy of $H$. For a graph~$H$ and a
  function $σ:E(H)\to \mathbb{N}$, the \emph{subdivision}
  $H^σ$ is obtained by replacing every $e \in E(H)$ with a path
  of length $σ(e)$. In~\cite{javadi25:_induced_long} it is shown
  that for all integers $r,\, D\geq 2 $, there exists a constant
  $c=c(r, D)$ such that for every graph $ H $ with maximum degree $D$
  if $H^σ$ is a subdivision of~$H$ in which
  $σ(e) > c \log n $ for every $e \in E(H)$, where
  $n=|V(H^σ)|$, then
  $ \widehat{R}_r(H^σ) = O\big(2^{34r}
  r^6 \log^5(r) D^5\log D\big)n. $ We improve upon this result in the case that~$H^σ$
  is a bipartite graph and the number of colors~$r$ is large using a
  significantly different argument, obtaining the bound
  $ \widehat{R}_r(H^σ) \leq r^{400D \log D} \, n $.

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22356v1.title: ラマヌジャン・サブシフト
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22356v1.summary: d+1次正則グラフにおける最適な相関減衰率を持つラマヌジャン条件を、高次元のℤᵟシフト空間へと拡張した「d正則ℤᵟ有限型シフト(SFT)」の概念を導入した。奇素数のべき乗qおよび次元δ < qに対し、Rungtanapirom-Stix-Vdovinaが導入した𝔽_q(t)上の四元数格子を用いることで、q正則なラマヌジャンℤᵟサブシフトを構成できることを示した。このサブシフトは非二部(q+1)次正則ラマヌジャングラフの族を導出し、そのグラフの隣接関係はサブシフトに付随するミーリー・オートマトンによって具体的に計算可能である。また、反復によって無限のラマヌジャングラフ族を生成できる単一のリフト規則も副産物として得られた。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22356v1.appendix: 本論文は、記号力学系(symbolic dynamics)における有限型シフト(SFT)の拡張を扱っており、さらにグラフの構成にオートマトン理論(automata theory)を用いている点で、指定された興味ある分野と深く関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22325v1.title: Pólyaの数え上げ、リース積対称関数、および曲線のモジュライ空間
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22325v1.summary: 本論文では、安定曲線および安定写像のモジュライ空間におけるSₙ等変オイラー標数を計算するための計算法を提示している。著者らは、グラフのPólyaサイクル指数多項式をリース積対称関数の代数Λ⁽²⁾へと拡張する手法を開発した。Macdonaldの基礎的研究に基づき、Λ⁽²⁾をベクトル空間の対称列からベクトル空間への多項式関手圏のグロタンディーク環として解釈できることを証明している。この解釈により、通常の対称関数環Λに対するΛ⁽²⁾の作用がアダムズ演算や冪和による歪化を用いて具体的に記述され、Sₙ等変オイラー標数の母関数について、通常の対称関数のみを用いた簡潔な公式を導出している。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22325v1.appendix: 本論文は代数的組み合わせ論に関連する手法を扱っており、指定された「興味ある分野」の中では広義のcombinatoricsとの関わりが深いです。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22183v1.title: アーベル埋め込みの視点
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22183v1.summary: 一般のk変数相関に関する逆定理の調査、およびそれらの相関が数学の多様な文脈でどのように生じるかを解説する。主要な研究成果と、離散数学や理論計算機科学におけるその応用、さらには今後の研究に向けた未解決問題について概説している。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22183v1.appendix: 離散数学および理論計算機科学への応用に触れており、興味ある分野の中では combinatorics on words との関連が示唆されます。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22181v1.title: 均質性をめぐって
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22181v1.summary: 45年前、有限置換群論の研究者がRobert Woodrowの論文で紹介された均質三角形非含有グラフに出会い、それがHigman-Simsグラフの無限系のアナロジーであると見出した経緯とその後の研究の歩みを詳述している。最終節では、硬構造（rigid structures）のFraïsséクラスがRamseyクラスの有望な一般化である可能性を提案している。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22181v1.appendix: 本論文で扱われるFraïsséクラスや均質構造の理論は、指定された分野のうち「structure of large countable infinite group」と密接に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22123v1.title: グラフ積における2次方程式と周期性の指数
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22123v1.summary: 1977年にマカニンは自由モノイドにおける方程式の決定可能性を確立し、その中で「周期性の指数」（単語に含まれる因子 pᵉ の最大の指数 e）という概念を導入した。本論文では、有限生成群における2次方程式に対して同様の問題を調査している。正規形を用いて周期性の指数を定義し、2次方程式系が無限の解集合を持つ場合に周期性の指数が非有界となるような、群とその正規形に関する構造的条件を特定した。この条件がグラフ積において保存されることを証明し、特に有限生成直交アルティン群、ねじれのないべき零群、および双曲群に対して成立することを示した。また、この条件を満たすボームスラッグ・ソリター群の指標付けも行っている。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.22123v1.appendix: 本論文は、自由モノイドや語の性質を扱う「combinatorics on words」および「formal languages」に関連しており、また直交アルティン群や双曲群などの「structure of large countable infinite group」の分野とも密接に関わっています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21895v1.title: 底 3/2 における Thue-Morse 語の記号頻度と関連する予想
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21895v1.summary: 底 3/2 の有理数進法における整数の展開から得られる二進の Thue-Morse 型数列の記号頻度を研究した論文である。この数列は射の周期的な反復で生成されるため、従来の Perron-Frobenius 法が直接適用できない。本稿では、記号 0 と 1 の出現頻度がともに 1/2 であることを示し、因子の集合の一様再帰性と対称性を証明した。手法として、第一差分数列の Toeplitz 性や 2 進整数群上の調和解析、スペクトル収縮の議論を組み合わせることで、Dekking の予想を解決している。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21895v1.appendix: この論文は、興味ある分野のうち symbolic dynamics および combinatorics on words に深く関連しています。有理数進法における自動点列の解析に、群上の調和解析を組み合わせた手法が特徴的です。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21870v1.title: Weyl群の層 (Strata)
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21870v1.summary: Weyl群 W は、W からその既約表現の集合への写像の非空なファイバーとして定義される「層 (strata)」と呼ばれる特定の共役類の和集合の集まりとして記述される。本論文では、修正された中心化群を用いることでこれらの層の明示的な記述を与える。さらに、連結簡約群における「超層 (superstrata)」を定義し、それらに関する予想を述べている。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21870v1.appendix: 本論文は代数群や表現論に焦点を当てており、指定された『興味ある分野』との直接的な関連性は低いですが、群の構造論という点では数学的な共通項を有しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21815v1.title: 直積作用における反復リース積の部分群増加について
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21815v1.summary: 本論文では、nからn^log nの間の任意のタイプにおける部分群増加（subgroup growth）を持つ遺伝的にジャスト無限な群（hereditarily just infinite groups）が存在することを示している。これは、有限置換群の直積作用による反復リース積を通じて得られる、遺伝的にジャスト無限な副有限群（profinite groups）の族について、その部分群増加のタイプを計算することで導き出された。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21815v1.appendix: 本論文は無限群の構造や副有限群の性質を扱っており、提示された興味ある分野の中では「structure of large countable infinite group」に特に関連があります。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21767v1.title: 近 似 Koopm a n 固 有 関 数 を 用 い た 保 証 付 き リ ア プ ノ フ 関 数 構 築 の た め の カ ー ネ ル 法
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21767v1.summary: 非 線 形 動 的 シ ス テ ム に 対 し て 、 近 似 的 な Koopm a n 固 有 関 数 を 利 用 し て リ ア プ ノ フ 関 数 を 構 築 す る カ ー ネ ル ベ ー ス の 手 法 を 提 案 し て い る 。 こ の 手 法 で は 、 Koopm a n 固 有 関 数 を シ ス テ ム の 線 形 化 に 基 づ く 線 形 部 分 と 、 再 生 核 ヒ ル ベ ル ト 空 間 (R K H S ) に お け る 対 称 カ ー ネ ル 選 点 法 を 用 い て 偏 微 分 方 程 式 を 解 く こ と で 得 ら れ る 非 線 形 部 分 に 分 解 す る 。 構 築 さ れ た リ ア プ ノ フ 関 数 は 、 こ れ ら の 近 似 固 有 関 数 の 二 次 形 式 と し て 定 義 さ れ る 。 選 点 ポ イ ン ト の 充 填 距 離 (f i l l d i s t a n c e ) に 応 じ た 近 似 精 度 の 誤 差 評 価 を 確 立 し 、 連 続 区 分 線 形 (C P A ) 法 を 用 い た 検 証 ・ 保 証 手 順 を 提 供 し て い る 。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21690v1.title: ループのイソトピー類におけるキラル性とラセミ化：亜群に基づく構造理論
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21690v1.summary: 有限ループのイソトピー類におけるキラル性とラセミ化の理論を、圏論的な意味でのループイソトピー亜群の枠組みで構築した。鏡像遷移を単位元を保存する内在的な対称性に限定し、ラセミ化をイソトピー類上の2状態力学系としてモデル化している。主な成果として、ラセミ化率がゼロになることと、ループとその反対ループの間にイソトピーが存在しないことが同値であることを示し、キラル性の構造的判定条件を与えた。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21690v1.appendix: 本論文はイソトピー類上の力学系モデルを扱っており、興味ある分野のうち symbolic dynamics や structure of large countable infinite group との関連が示唆されます。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21674v1.title: エラー認識による能動的オートマトン学習の高速化
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21674v1.summary: 能動的オートマトン学習（AAL）は、システムとの相互作用を通じて動作モデルを学習する手法であるが、入力数が多い大規模なモデルへのスケーリングが大きな課題となっている。既存のアルゴリズムは、多くの入力がエラーを生成するような場合でも効率的に動作しない。本論文では、エラーが観測可能なシステムを対象に、どの入力がどの状態で非エラーとなるかというドメイン知識のレベルに応じた最新の学習アルゴリズム L# の適応手法を提案した。評価実験により、ドメイン知識の活用度に応じて、学習速度が1桁から数桁向上することが実証された。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21674v1.appendix: この論文は興味ある分野のうち、automata theory および formal languages に密接に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21623v1.title: フィボナッチ型単峰写像におけるタワーとBratteli-Vershikシステム
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21623v1.summary: フィボナッチ型の単峰写像のクラスにおいて、唯一の折返し点のω極限集合への制限は極小カントール系を定義する。本論文では、タワー構造を持つ有限被覆の入れ子状の列を用いて、これらのカントール集合を幾何学的に構成する。このタワー構造から、切断時刻（cutting times）によって決定される随伴Bratteli-Vershikモデルを復元し、ω極限集合上に支持される一意的なエルゴード的不変確率測度の明示的な公式を得る。最後に、この構成の適用範囲を示す応用について述べる。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21623v1.appendix: 本論文は、興味ある分野のうち symbolic dynamics および complex dynamics に関連しています。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21494v1.title: 最小距離6および局所性3を持つSingleton-optimalな局所回復可能符号の構成
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21494v1.summary: 本論文では、有限幾何学の組合せ構造に基づき、最小距離d=6かつ局所性r=3を持つq元Singleton-optimal局所回復可能符号(LRCs)の新しい構成法を提案している。位数qの互いに直交するラテン方格(MOLS)の完全集合とアフィン平面AG(2,q)の間の対応関係を利用し、射影平面PG(2,q)において、任意の2つの異なる4-arcの和集合が8-arcとなるような互いに素な4-arcの族を体系的に構築した。これらの4-arcは「4-local arcs」と呼ばれ、その存在は目的の符号の存在と同等である。q ≧ 7の任意の素数冪に対し、qの偶奇や4に関する剰余系に応じて、符号長n = 2q, 2q-2, または2q-6の符号が得られる。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21494v1.appendix: 本論文は有限幾何学および組合せ論的な構造（MOLSなど）を用いているため、興味ある分野の「combinatorics on words」や離散数学的な側面と関連性があります。

http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21459v1.title: 後方参照に起因する正規表現サービス拒否攻撃 (ReDoS)
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21459v1.summary: 後方参照を含む正規表現 (REwB) におけるサービス拒否攻撃 (ReDoS) 脆弱性に関する初の体系的な研究である。本論文では、REwB のセマンティクスを正確に捉えるための「Two-Phase Memory Automaton (2PMFA)」というオートマトンモデルを導入した。このモデルを用いて、既存の検出器では特定困難であった、後方参照が超線形なバックトラッキング実行時間を引き起こすための必要条件を導出し、3つの脆弱性パターンを特定した。Snort の侵入検知ルールセットを用いた評価では、45件の未知の脆弱性を発見し、実際の攻撃によって処理遅延や検知回避が可能であることを実証した。
http://arxiv.org/abs/2602.21459v1.appendix: 本論文は、オートマトン理論 (automata theory) および形式言語 (formal languages) の分野に密接に関連しています。特に、後方参照を持つ正規表現という計算能力の高い言語モデルを解析するために新しいオートマトンモデルを提案している点が、これらの分野における重要な貢献となっています。
